description:
A series of digest animations commemorating the 3rd anniversary of the "Project SEKAI COLORFUL STAGE! feat. Hatsune Miku" mobile game.

This entry includes:
1) Leo/need ダイジェストアニメーション - Journey to Bloom『STELLA』
2) MORE MORE JUMP! ダイジェストアニメーション - Journey to Bloom『HOPE』
3) Vivid BAD SQUAD ダイジェストアニメーション - Journey to Bloom『RESOLVE』
4) ワンダーランズ×ショウタイム ダイジェストアニメーション - Journey to Bloom『HAPPINESS』
5) 25時、ナイトコードで。 ダイジェストアニメーション - Journey to Bloom『SELF』

tags.name: Band
tags.description: Main cast is a group of musicians.

tags.name: Idol
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of an idol.

tags.name: Artificial Intelligence
tags.description: Intelligent non-organic machines that work and react similarly to humans.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Alternate Universe
tags.description: Features multiple alternate universes in the same series.

tags.name: Isekai
tags.description: Features characters being transported into an alternate world setting and having to adapt to their new surroundings.

tags.name: Primarily Female Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of female characters.

tags.name: Primarily Teen Cast
tags.description: Main cast is mostly composed of teen characters.

tags.name: Transgender
tags.description: Features a character whose gender identity differs from the sex they were assigned at birth.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: School
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a primary or secondary educational institution.

tags.name: Real Robot
tags.description: Prominently features mechanical designs loosely influenced by real-world robotics.

tags.name: Robots
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid machines.

tags.name: Acting
tags.description: Centers around actors or the acting industry.

tags.name: Bullying
tags.description: Prominently features the use of force for intimidation, often in a school setting.

tags.name: Found Family
tags.description: Features a group of characters with no biological relations that are united in a group providing social support.

tags.name: Bar
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a bar.

tags.name: Twins
tags.description: Prominently features two or more siblings that were born at one birth.

tags.name: Musical Theater
tags.description: Features a performance that combines songs, spoken dialogue, acting, and dance.

tags.name: Rock Music
tags.description: Centers on the musical style of rock, not to be applied to anime that use rock in its soundtrack.

tags.name: Kemonomimi
tags.description: Prominently features humanoid characters with animal ears.

tags.name: Nekomimi
tags.description: Humanoid characters with cat-like features such as cat ears and a tail.

tags.name: Virtual World
tags.description: Partly or completely set in the world inside a video game.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Vocal Synth
tags.description: Features one or more singers or characters that are products of a synthesize singing program. Popular examples are Vocaloids, UTAUloids, and CeVIOs.

tags.name: Cute Girls Doing Cute Things
tags.description: Centers around female characters doing cute activities, usually with little to no emphasis on drama and conflict.

tags.name: Restaurant
tags.description: Features a business that prepares and serves food and drinks to customers. Also encompasses cafes and bistros.

tags.name: Hip-hop Music
tags.description: Centers on the musical style of hip-hop, not to be applied to anime that use hip-hop in its soundtrack.

tags.name: Female Protagonist
tags.description: Main character is female.

node.description:
Affiliated with [P.A. Works](https://anilist.co/studio/132/) since 2009.

Debuted as a character designer on [Irozuku Sekai no Ashita kara](https://anilist.co/anime/101316/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/masatoshitsuji)

Originating from [Kyoto Animation](https://anilist.co/studio/2/). Former [Ufotable](https://anilist.co/studio/43/) employee, currently freelance.
